# Write some functions to save space

```{r}
run_ep_method1_setting1_simulation <- function(a_vec = c(2, 4, 6, 8, 10), 
                                               alpha = .05,
                                               exponent = .5,
                                               num_iter = 500){
result_vec_power <- c()
result_vec_fdr <- c()
for (amp in a_vec){
  result <- run_ep_method1_simulation(n = 200,
                                          d = 40,
                                          a = amp, 
                                          num_true_sigs = 8,
                                          alpha = alpha,
                                          exponent = exponent,
                                          num_iter = num_iter)
  result_vec_power <- c(result_vec_power, result$power)
  result_vec_fdr <- c(result_vec_fdr, result$fdr)
}
return(data.frame(a = a_vec, power = result_vec_power, fdr = result_vec_fdr))
}
```

```{r}
set.seed(12)
temp_df <- run_ep_method1_setting1_simulation(exponent = 1/4)
# gives exactly the same results as in the previous document (ep-BH-procedure) - code works like it should
```


```{r}
run_ep_method1_setting2_simulation <- function(a_vec = c(2, 4, 6, 8, 10), 
                                               alpha = .05,
                                               exponent = .5,
                                               num_iter = 500){
result_vec_power <- c()
result_vec_fdr <- c()
for (amp in a_vec){
  result <- run_ep_method1_simulation(n = 500,
                                          d = 50,
                                          a = amp, 
                                          num_true_sigs = 10,
                                          alpha = alpha,
                                          exponent = exponent,
                                          num_iter = num_iter)
  result_vec_power <- c(result_vec_power, result$power)
  result_vec_fdr <- c(result_vec_fdr, result$fdr)
}
return(data.frame(a = a_vec, power = result_vec_power, fdr = result_vec_fdr))
}
```

# Run the simulations for setting 2 and different exponents


```{r}
ep_method1_0_setting2 <- run_ep_method1_setting2_simulation(exponent = 0)
```

```{r}
ep_method1_1_16_setting2 <- run_ep_method1_setting2_simulation(exponent = 1/16)
```

```{r}
ep_method1_1_8_setting2 <- run_ep_method1_setting2_simulation(exponent = 1/8)
```




# Graphs for setting 2 simulations


```{r}
# Setting 1 Power
ggplot(ep_method1_0_setting2, aes(x = a, y = power)) + 
  geom_line(color = 'red') +
  geom_point(shape = 4, color = 'red') + 
  scale_y_continuous(limits = c(0, 1)) +
  labs(x = 'Signal Strength - Amplitude', y = 'Simulated Power', title = 'ep Method 1 Setting 2 Results - exponent = 1 (n = 500, d = 50, k = 10)')
```

```{r}
# Setting 1 FDR
ggplot(ep_method1_0_setting2, aes(x = a, y = fdr)) + 
  geom_line(color = 'red') +
  geom_point(shape = 4, color = 'red') + 
  scale_y_continuous(limits = c(0, .15)) +
  labs(x = 'Signal Strength - Amplitude', y = 'Simulated FDR', title = 'ep Method 1 Setting 2 Results - exponent = 0 (n = 500, d = 50, k = 10)')
```
